title: $ Tshirts
content: Does anyone know where I can find any Tshirts that are (how do I say it) Type sensitive. For Example If a typographer or Hand Letter did a line of Tshirts this is where I would go. I know Ken Barber has a line House 33 but can't find anywhere to buy it. I tried his site but looks unfinished. I have also seen a shirt that has KERN on it but no clue where it is either. Thanks
author: orso2932

comments.content: Adobe put out a series of type-related Tshirts a number of years ago: I've still got my "Type is to wear" one.

Veer.com has the KERN zip-up and lots of other goodies.

[http://www.veer.com/products/merch/tshirts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.veer.com/products/merch/tshirts/ "http://www.veer.com/products/merch/tshirts/")

Threadless has a collection of [Typetees](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.threadless.com/catalog/typetees), but they sell out very quickly. While you are there check out t-shirts lettered and designed by the absolutely brilliant [Ray Fenwick](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.threadless.com/product/509/HI).

A superb type tee:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/oded\_ezer/179166694/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/oded_ezer/179166694/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/oded\_ezer/179166694/") \_  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/oded\_ezer/305580374/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/oded_ezer/305580374/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/oded\_ezer/305580374/")

hhp

Hrant, those are major cool!

ChrisL

Yeah, pretty impressive. He won one of the TDC Awards for Typographic Excellence for that design. You can see more on his site, [www.odedezer.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.odedezer.com/ "www.odedezer.com").
There are a limited set remaining of Typophile tees, in several designs, if you're interested. Let me know your shirt size and I can see what we have left.
How about [Typotheque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.typotheque.com/tshirts/)?
[http://typophile.com/node/19019](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/typophile.com/node/19019 "http://typophile.com/node/19019")

Here is an idea for a T-shirt:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957im_/http:/typophile.com/files/maeWest_3573.png)

ChrisL

Hotel clerk: Goodness, Miss West, those are beautiful jewels.  
Mae West: Ah, "goodness" had nothing to do with them....
[http://vllg.com/products/Village/ForLikeEver/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/vllg.com/products/Village/ForLikeEver/ "http://vllg.com/products/Village/ForLikeEver/")

Va rum-pah-chiish! :-)

ChrisL
Another Mae-ism: "I used to be as pure as snow, but I drifted...." ;-)

more:

She: We're intellectual opposites.  
He: What do you mean?  
She: I'm intellectual and you're opposite.

When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad I'm better.

A number that haven't been mentioned: Emigre's two [script logo t-shirts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/emigre.com/Tshirt.php), House Industries' two ["Rat Fink"](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=clothing&category=rat_fink_tees) tees, based on a Rat Fink foundry, I guess, and PsyOps' [four dummy text tees and their simplifify one](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.psyops.com/html/p_dummy.html). I especially like the PsyOps ones.

_When I’m good, I’m very good, but when I’m bad I’m better._

Geez, I was saving that one. ;-)

"I've got 'Christmas' tatooed on one thigh, and 'New Year's' on the other: come up and see me between the holidays...." (and what woman wouldn't have said that to Cary Grant?)

Typophile regular Mark Simonson offers these:

[http://www.cafepress.com/marksimonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.cafepress.com/marksimonson "http://www.cafepress.com/marksimonson")

I put this up one night when I couldn't sleep.  
 [http://www.cafepress.com/exclamachine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.cafepress.com/exclamachine "http://www.cafepress.com/exclamachine")

[Choz Cunningham](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.chozcunningham.com/)  
 [!Exclamachine Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.exclamchine.com/)  
 [The Snark](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.exclamachine.com/snark)

Guess [Letter Wheels](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.crauswords.com/flowers/FWheels.pdf) are not bad for Umbrellas and T-shirts?!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Umbrella_6685.JPG)

\>“I’ve got ‘Christmas’ tatooed on one thigh, and ‘New Year’s’ on the other: come up and see me between the holidays….” (and what woman wouldn’t have said that to Cary Grant?"

Pick up lines were so much more imaginative in those days Linda :-)

ChrisL

Those guys have some nice T's too:  
 [http://www.thepeoplesbureau.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.thepeoplesbureau.com/ "http://www.thepeoplesbureau.com")

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
AL  
 [lenart.pl](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.lenart.pl/)
@Jared: I am still waiting for the free T that should have come with my subscription (paid in May 2005).

<cite>I know Ken Barber has a line House 33</cite>

House Industries t-shirts are available here: [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=merchandise](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=merchandise "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=merchandise")

Although they don't seem to have many at the moment. House 33 is an offshoot shop, not sure if it's active at the moment/any more.

One of my favorite Mae-isms:

"You know how to whistle, dontcha baby. Just put your lips together and blow."

Lauren Bacall surely

[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0037382/quotes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0037382/quotes "http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0037382/quotes")

Tim

Gah!!! Tim thank you, I'm ashamed.

It was her character Slim in the movie "To Have and Have Not." She said it to Steve as acted by Humphrey Bogart.

"You know you don't have to act with me, Steve. You don't have to say anything, and you don't have to do anything. Not a thing. Oh, maybe just whistle. You know how to whistle, don't you, Steve? You just put your lips together and... blow. "

No problem and no shame.

I cannot imagine being able to whistle if Lauren Bacall had said that to me (or move from the spot) :)

Tim

Linda, I thought it was "I used to be Snow White, but I drifted."

K.

Chris: Yeah, pick-up lines have really gone downhill in the last hundred years. Remeber that oldie-but-goodie from the sixties "hey, what's your sign" and the appropriate answer usually being "exit"?

Kristina: I can't think of anyone ever mistaking Ms. West for Snow White, somehow.... ;-)

We offer a complementary typographic T-shirt for every purchase over a certain amount:  
 [http://www.luth.no/default.asp?side=fontprisliste&Searchstring=T-skjorte](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/www.luth.no/default.asp?side=fontprisliste&Searchstring=T-skjorte "http://www.luth.no/default.asp?side=fontprisliste&Searchstring=T-skjorte")

Haven't though of selling them separately, though...

Jacob

We had a thread going about people creating typographic t-shirts. Has someone mentioned that already?

[Print-Screening/T-shirts, T's Ideas](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/typophile.com/node/28677)

Duncan

Just for Tiff and Tim:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bacallBlow_4442.jpg)

ChrisL
She has got to be the most gorgeous woman ever.

So do you think if she gave a guy that look, he could turn away?

Not a chance :-)

ChrisL

\>he could turn away?

Especially if she were 20, and he 45 and named Humphrey.

She's Shimon Peres's first cousin.

He isn't as cute :)

That look reminds me of the teen sluts now so prevalent  
in the Victoria's Secret catalogs. But of course, des goûts  
et des couleurs on ne discute pas.

hhp

\>teen sluts

Bogart, Sinatra, Robards, ...Papazian?

\>on ne discute pas.

except if you're hhp or wb & then 'on discute tout' :)

Fake smiley.

I tried not to give an opinion, just point out what that reminds me of (and the similarity is striking). Oh well, another sacred cow trampled I guess. Oooops!

hhp

à chacun son goût

Thanks Chris

Tim

So anyway, T-shirts....

I sure hope House puts out some glitzy tees to commemorate the Luxury collection. Those I would wear to the mall.

I guess this is one of those days when I wish I could understand French.

Moving right along...

[Edited out do to mistaken info]

ChrisL
[http://romibello.de/romibello.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957/http:/romibello.de/romibello.htm "http://romibello.de/romibello.htm")

The Luxury fonts aren't pricey, Chris, the House release has them priced normally. Careful what you whine about. Check their website.

The catalog for the Luxury collection is fantastic; they've outdone themselves in absurd copywriting, overproduction and gorgeous presentation. I think they could charge for the "privilege of ownership" to a catalog.

Carl,  
Then what is the very expensive face that I am thinking of? It had a name that conotes luxury or exclusivity?

I just checked their site. The whole set is the typical $250. I edited out my above post so as not to lead others astray.  
I still wonder what that $5000 typeface was that I was thinking of?

ChrisL

Ivo,  
I like this one from your link:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018120957im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Selvetica_3885.jpg)

ChrisL

The Luxury set was originally released by its designers, Christian Schwartz and Dino Sanchez, without the text variants. That version was priced exhorbitantly; it was something of a prank. The House release is just an expansion and re-release, though House brought their inimitable marketing genius to the project. The original Luxury set is what you're thinking of.

Now I get it, it was all a ruse.

Here is explanatory text from Christian Scwartz's site explaining how his tongue-in-cheek got blown out of proportion:  
"Once a conceptual art project that commented on the high price of a certain aesthetic, the Luxury Collection is now available to the general public through House Industries. It has been celebrated as a brilliant joke and maligned as self-indulgence. A friend pointed us to a thread on a type blog where someone with a limited sense of humor (or maybe someone trying to be even more tongue-in-cheek than we were) said, "...they are very full of themselves. I bet they go belly up pretty soon. In these economic times no client will pony-up that kind of money." Wink wink, nudge nudge?"

ChrisL

I see we cross-posted.Thanks for the info anyway Carl. Another urban myth is squelched :-) Time to watch another hilarious episode of "Myth Busters"

ChrisL

It was indeed a great prank - almost as good as the Chalet thing (which I remember falling for, even if only for a day or so). But "normalizing" the price was not very wise - it should've stayed stratospheric. All it's become now is just another product.

hhp
